name: Maui Banana Cream Tube Cake
author: Savoy Rouge
summary: This cake was created for Reds Espresso Gallery of San Diego, in the Maui test kitchen on Puunoa! It was first made with bananas from the back yard...yummy!
ingredients: 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lightly grease and flour a 10-inch fluted tube pan
Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth
Beat first egg into butter until completely blended, then beat in vanilla extract with last egg; fold in bananas
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
Stir flour mixture into creamed mixture alternately with yogurt, stirring until just combined
Fold in pecans and pour batter into prepared tube pan
Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean, about 50 minutes
Cool 10 minutes in pan before removing to a wire rack to cool completely
Dust with confectioner's sugar before serving
